If you're still overlooking @billions_ntwk, it's time to take a closer look.

Billions is building a decentralized identity network where both humans and AI agents can prove their uniqueness no gatekeepers, no assumptions.

It's mobile-first, powered by zk-proofs, making identity verification private, secure, and truly scalable.

Built on the Privado ID infrastructure, Billions is creating a global trust layer for identity, reputation, and financial inclusion within its ecosystem.

And yes $BILL is its native token.
It powers verification, rewards, and long-term ecosystem growth.

The final snapshot is fast approaching.
Don't say you weren't warned.

Many crypto projects achieved their TGE in 2025 but the tokens of most projects did not perform well after launch. The main reason for this was that the projects launched the tokens but the planning, demand and trust that should have been behind it were missing. In simple words, the tokens came into the market but there were few real people to buy and hold them.

Another major problem was that the real purpose of many projects' tokens was unclear. People couldn't understand the benefit of holding these tokens. Neither a strong product was ready, nor were users active. TGE was launched solely on the basis of hype and as soon as the hype died down, the token also plummeted. Furthermore, bots and fake accounts spoiled many TGEs, where real users didn't get a fair chance.

Now let's talk about 2026. In 2026, the market is becoming more mature. People are looking not just at tokens but at trust, real users and long-term value. This is where the role of @billions_ntwk  becomes very important.

Billions Network focus is to determine who is a real human and who is a bot or fake account in Web3. It provides an identity and verification layer, while maintaining privacy. This means that users can prove they are a real person without revealing their personal details.

If the TGEs in 2026 are implemented with systems like Billions Network, token launches could be more fair. Only real people will participate, not bots. This will ensure tokens don't end up in the wrong hands and reduce sell pressure. The community may be small but it will be strong and genuine.

Another benefit is that projects will know that the people supporting their tokens are genuine, not just hype or manipulation. Trust will increase and those who acquire tokens will not be buying them just to dump them but for long-term use and growth.

The 2025 TGEs failed because they focused solely on token launches, not on systems and people. The focus is shifting in 2026 Identity, trust and real participation are becoming crucial. And projects like the Billion Network will serve as a bridge to this change, making future TGEs more stable, fair and sustainable.
@jgonzalezferrer

Why now? Identity in the age of AI

We‚Äôve entered a world where:

‚Ä¢ Faces can be generated
‚Ä¢ Voices can be cloned
‚Ä¢ Documents can be faked

If anyone can pretend to be anyone, trust becomes the real scarcity.  

That‚Äôs where networks like @billions_ntwk come in.

Deepfakes and synthetic IDs aren‚Äôt sci‚Äëfi anymore.

Scams now use:
‚Ä¢ AI voices pretending to be family
‚Ä¢ Fake ‚ÄúKYC selfies‚Äù generated by models
‚Ä¢ Synthetic documents that pass basic checks

Legacy KYC and captchas were never designed for this level of AI.

In this world, identity infra needs to do two opposite things at once:

1. Be strong enough to resist AI‚Äëgenerated fakes.
2. Be private enough that users aren‚Äôt doxxed or mass‚Äësurveilled.

That balance is the whole design goal behind Billions‚Äô verification + ZK model.

Billions‚Äô timing is strong because it sits exactly at the intersection of:

‚Ä¢ AI getting powerful enough to break old defenses
‚Ä¢ Web3 needing Sybil‚Äëresistant users, not just wallets
‚Ä¢ Regulators pushing for better verification, but users demanding privacy
A human & AI network with reusable, ZK‚Äëbacked credentials is built for this moment.

Identity wasn‚Äôt a big problem when:
‚Ä¢ Bots were dumb
‚Ä¢ Deepfakes were rare
‚Ä¢ Onchain incentives were small
But with AI‚Äëagents, billion‚Äëdollar airdrops, and global onchain finance, ‚Äúwho is on the other side?‚Äù becomes the core question.

That‚Äôs why identity infra like Billions isn‚Äôt just a side quest ,

it‚Äôs becoming base layer.

$BILL (Billions Network) Premarket Snapshot & Launch Outlook
Source: @whalespremarket + official tokenomics by @billions_ntwk

At ~$0.010‚Äì0.012 on Whales premarket, $BILL is currently in a price discovery phase, not a momentum phase.

Premarket observations:
‚Ä¢ Low volatility with limited speculative flow
‚Ä¢ Thin but stable volume, no forced buying or selling
‚Ä¢ Order flow indicates controlled positioning rather than distribution

This structure typically appears when:
‚Ä¢ Supply remains constrained
‚Ä¢ Emissions are staged, not front-loaded
‚Ä¢ Utility is expected post-launch, not driven by pre-launch hype

Tokenomics context:
Billions is not optimized for short-term reflexivity. The design emphasizes:
‚Ä¢ Long-term ecosystem alignment
‚Ä¢ Incentives linked to identity, reputation, and participation
‚Ä¢ Gradual supply activation over immediate liquidity expansion

As a result:
‚Ä¢ Premarket prices serve as a risk-reference range
‚Ä¢ Not as confirmation of near-term upside

Listing window outlook (non-binding):
‚Ä¢ Tokenomics published
‚Ä¢ Premarket live
‚Ä¢ Product and identity infrastructure actively shipping

‚Üí A reasonable expectation is late Q1 to early Q2 2026, assuming no strategic delays.

Bottom line:
‚Ä¢ This is not a volatility trade
‚Ä¢ It is an early underwriting of infrastructure risk
‚Ä¢ Value accrual depends on adoption, not attention

Size positions accordingly.

Most Ai agents act almost none are accountable.

That gap is becoming the biggest risk in Ai.

Know Your Agent (KYA) by @billions_ntwk fixes it by turning Ai agents into verifiable actors not black boxes.

What KYA changes

‚Ä¢ Ai agents get a real cryptographic identity (DID)
‚Ä¢ Every agent has a clear owner
‚Ä¢ Reputation is public, composable and provable
‚Ä¢ Trust is enforced by code, not promises

Why this matters Ai agents now execute trades, decisions, workflows and policies.
Without identity ¬ª no accountability without accountability ¬ª no trust at scale.

KYA gives:

‚Ä¢ Enterprises auditability without central gatekeepers
‚Ä¢ Builders open infrastructure, not closed platforms
‚Ä¢ Users trust without giving up privacy

How it works

‚Ä¢ Agents self-generate identities via the Agent JS SDK
‚Ä¢ Ownership, audits, and reputation are recorded as onchain attestations
‚Ä¢ Humans stay private via zero-knowledge proofs
‚Ä¢ Agents stay accountable via public verification
‚Ä¢ Reputation compounds over time no single party controls it

The shift Verification moves before value, access and incentives.
Trust becomes proactive not reactive.

This isn‚Äôt KYC for Ai it is identity as infrastructure for autonomous systems.

Ai needs accountability to scale KYA is how that foundation gets built.

Billions Network: Verifying Human and AI Identity Securely and Privately.

‚ÄãBillions Network is a privacy-focused digital identity platform built to verify real humans and AI agents without exposing personal data. It uses 'zero knowledge proof' technology to ensure secure and fast verification through a mobile experience. @billions_ntwk

‚ÄãThis project enables a single, reusable identity that can be used across Web3 applications and online platforms, helping to prevent bots, fake accounts, and Sybil attacks. By combining privacy, usability, and trust, Billions Network aims to become a foundational identity layer for the next generation of the internet. $BILL

Being real online used to be assumed
Today it has to be proven

Bots can copy profiles
AI can imitate behavior and usernames don‚Äôt mean much anymore

That is why Billions Network is introducing Official Profiles

An Official Profile lets you claim a uniqueness credential
a simple badge that proves this account belongs to a real human

The important part it does not reveal who you are
No names
No documents
No biometrics stored

Behind the scenes
Billions uses cryptographic proofs so apps can verify you are real without accessing your personal data

As more platforms integrate this being verified would not mean being exposed

It will mean being trusted
